If not...I'll have to go and check it otu myself.
author: O ..

description: I was really hyped up to try this place because we could always use more good breakfast places in the 'deep mish'. Unfortunately, I left feeling eh. Service was definitely friendly but selection was pretty bare bones. I got the onion and avocado omelette. When they say avocado, they mean dumping the entire half smack in the middle of the omelette. I would have preferred if they took a quick second to slice it up and disperse evenly. Yes, I'm nitpicking.  In general, I would go back here if my other top breakfast places have a long line.
author: Susan L.

description: Well the food is bad, but if you are looking for a cheap place to go with friends I guess you could do worse...maybe.  They really only get 2 stars because the staff is nice and the green sauce makes everything better.
author: Cork C.

description: love love love Jims! nice simple diner. cool, friendly staff. good food. great green salsa!
author: Codie T.

description: We recently had our last meal at Jim's - We used to go there pretty often on Sundays for a cheap breakfast or lunch. The last two times we had bad service. This last visit we were seated at a filthy table, had to wait 20 minutes for someone to come and clean it and finally take our order. Another 30 minutes for our food to arrive (no coffee refills while waiting - impossible to get waitress's attention) only to discover that my grilled cheese sandwich didnt even have melted cheese and the fries were barely cooked. They took it back and didn't charge me but I left hungry and grabbed a burrito on the way home
author: Bumble B.

description: Jims is great. Yummy yummy homeade garlic salsa, good breakfast, and everyone is always so friendly. I usually go for the standard breakfast fare and it never dissapoints.
author: Britney K.

description: EXCELLENT service, actually GOOD coffee, and they serve your breakfast with a bowl of jalepenos and the most mouth watering, amazing, garlicky, homemade green salsa.  Like the review on the cash register says: You won't find any brioche french toast or fru fru cocktails, but you will get your basics served up HOT and fast.  Definitely coming back.
author: Allie L.

description: It's a plateload of calories for cheap.  Breakfast served all day with quite a few booths to sit at.  Average quality but fairly large portions.  My wife thinks the eggs and coffee could be better for a breakfast place, and I would tend to agree.  I had bacon and eggs, and everything kinda smelled like movie popcorn butter.  Even the bacon.  I won't deny that it was good, but probably only 3 stars good.  Indeed, the bathroom was less than stellar, but functional.
author: Willis W.

description:
some people might call this place "nothing special."

but a cheap greasy no bullshit diner with friendly service is somewhat of a rarity these days, especially in this city.
author: R E.

description: If for no other reason, go here to tip the waitresses well.  They rock.  Cut up my pancakes when my arm was in a cast.  Remember me every time I come in- once or twice a year, sometimes I even skip a year!  Not the best food, mind you, but the nicest ladies in town.
author: Joann M.

description: Simple, decent, cheap. Staff was really friendly. I walked in and sat at the counter, and placed my order. A few minutes later i was eating a deluxe burger with fries. My coke never ran dry. Wouldn't head there in search of the best burger in town or anything, but it will satiate your hunger. Can't expect for more for $7.
author: Ross M.

description: I looovvee this place. I worked on the same block and I would come here a lot! Their prices are really cheap and you leave really full.. I love the breakfast scrambled eggs and two sausages with hash brown and wheat toast mm mm, the best and its only like $5.50. Also try their current specials which is Hot dog delight it's really good and their Teryiaki one too I'm not too crazy about the white rice but over all it's good. Almost everything they have here looks and taste very good. As for the waitresses I preferred Maria she's so nice and checks up on you or suggests things she's the best so make sure to tip her ! Lol.
author: Stephanie M.

description: finally, a real diner. with real diner food at real diner prices. hearts you jims.
author: Lily S.

description: food is pretty standard. booth chairs are pretty worn and uncomfortable. bathroom is pretty small and shady.
author: Tiff C.

description: this is definitely a typical cheap dinner with very reasonable prices.  i got the vegetarian eggs benedict.  it was pretty delicious.
author: Katie H.

description: well... i like this place. They have a breakfast special for only $5.50 two eggs, hash-brown, any meat (ham,bacon,or sausage) and toast. You cant beat that....
author: Dalia C.

description: Good food, good service, good atmosphere. I've searched long and hard for this combination and finally found it at Jim's. Love coming here for breakfast to nurse the occasional hangover or just to read the Sunday paper. If I ever left San Francisco, this is one of the places I would miss the most.
author: Pia S.

description: I've been comming here ever since I was 7 years old.  Breakfast is delicious and you can't beat the price.  Lunch is ok, they have sandwiches and burgers which are good but they are known more for their  breakfast.
author: Jenny R.

description: so i went for the killer. the chicken fried steak which came with hash browns and my order of over hard eggs. i felt a bit guilty and subsituted a side of veggies for the toast. my plate arrived. supermonochrome. everything was a lite brown. guiltyumm-mmmm. my justification was a three hour dance rehearsal later that evening. and as my partner in crime so appropriately stated, "you'll need the energy" That i did. Thanks Jim!
author: a w.

description: jim's is an old-school diner that's great for weekend brunch for 2 with coffee and oj for under $20 - who can beat that?
author: michelle k.

description: this is one of my more favorite diners in san francisco, land of over priced eggs and bacon with inexplicable lines waiting for mediocre food. this and lucky penny. so far, i've never had to wait for a table at jim's and i pray that the gentrification crowd never finds it or its landlord, so that it stays cheap and pleasant forever. nice friendly family environment, and at the same time not judgmental/ suspicious of those of us who may be less traditional. out of four pieces of bacon, i'd say one was delicious, two ok, and one dry and overcooked. i love their buttery hash browns, but i'm not a super healthy eater; dieters probably should avoid this place. the chicken fried steak is surprisingly good although the gravy a little odd (from a freeze dried package?). the cheeseburger & fries are pretty decent. coffee is average, but i like diner coffee, being from the East Coast and an avid fan of road tripping... the bathroom is kind of scary - not recommended. best part - you can have a whole meal for about five bucks plus tip.
author: Dorothy W.
